content: note the video tutorial is still accessible and free but the written pattern is now for sale in a bundle that is scheduled to be discontinued at some unspecified time written pattern can be purchased here 1 the simple everyday eyelet cardigan is an easy drop shoulder open cardigan knit in the staggered eyelet stitch the staggered eyelet gives the cardigan a unique texture you can wear all year round the back front panels and sleeves are knit separately and then seamed together the cardigan is meant to fit a bit oversized because of its drop shoulder construction **instructions are written so that you can knit this sweater in any gauge** any yarn weight and needle size please use these instructions as a guide to determine your cast on stitches for each section watch the full video tutorial 2 **size guide + finished measurements** sizes written in 1 2 3 4 5 6 this sweater has about 8-12 in/20 5-30 5 cm of positive ease so pick a sweater size accordingly for example if you re a 37 in/94 cm bust a size 2 or 3 would be appropriate the thinner the yarn the less ease you might need because the sweater won t be as bulky **yarn** i used 2 5 skeins of lion brand re-spun thick + quick yarn 223 yds/204 m per 12oz/340g skein for a size 3 sweater knit on 9mm us 13 needles you can estimate yardage based on your gauge swatch and calculate overall square inches or centimeters you can use whatever yarn weight you would like **needles** i used a 9mm us 13 40 in/101 cm circular needle to knit the entire cardigan feel free to go down a needle size for ribbing you can also knit this on straight needles or shorter circular needles but you will need a long circular needle for the collar if you pick up and knit the ribbing you can use whatever needle size you would like 1 https //www ashleylillis com/blog/2022/6/24/free-sweater-pattern-tutorial-simple-everyday-eyelet-cardigan 2 https //youtu be/lqbu-kesw2e
